member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.CommentInfo
member.summary:
Represents an annotation reference mark at the current location in the comment.
An annotation reference mark is an information block that represents the metadata associated with the current comment. The annotation reference mark should typically consist of the initials and a unique integer associated with its position in the document, but can be displayed in any desired format.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ContinuationSeparatorMark
member.summary:
Represents a continuation separator mark within a run.
A continuation separator mark is a horizontal line that spans the width of the main story's text extents. The continuation separator mark is typically used within the context of continuation separator footnotes or endnotes. These footnote and endnote types define the footnote/endnote used to separate the contents of the main document story from continuation of footnotes or endnotes that began on a previous page.

member.summary:
Represents a separator mark within the current run.
A separator mark is a horizontal line that spans part of the width text extents. The separator mark is typically used within the context of separator footnotes or endnotes. These footnote and endnote types define the footnote/endnote used to separate the contents of the main document story from the contents of footnotes or endnotes on that page.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Paragraph.TextId
member.summary: Gets or sets a version identifier for the paragraph.
member.remarks: Values MUST be greater than 0 and less than 0x80000000. If this property is specified the MUST be specified also. If two documents have the same docId, then if two elements within the same respective body that have the same and SHOULD contain identical text, although formatting could differ.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Paragraph.NoSpellingErrors
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the text of the paragraph is free of detected spelling errors.
member.remarks: A value of true specifies that no spelling errors were detected in this paragraph. A value of false specifies that no information is available about spelling errors in the text of the paragraph.

member.summary:
Represents a contiguous area of content objects in a document. Unlike , PersistentRange is kept alive and can be used even if the content used to create this range has been deleted.
Importnant: to avoid performance degradation, you should dispose PersistentRange when it is no longer needed.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.LocationRelation
member.summary: Specifies the result of comparing two range locations.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.LocationRelation.Unrelated
member.summary: This instance and the other range are in different bodies.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.LocationRelation.Equal
member.summary: This instance and the other range represent the same range.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.LocationRelation.ContainsStart
member.summary: This instance contains the other range and both have the same start, but different end locations.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.LocationRelation.ContainsEnd
member.summary: This instance contains the other range and both have the same end, but different start locations.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.LocationRelation.Contains
member.summary: This instance contains the other range, and both start and end of this instance are outside the other range.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.LocationRelation.InsideStart
member.summary: This instance is inside the other range and both have the same start, but different end locations.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.LocationRelation.InsideEnd
member.summary: This instance is inside the other range and both have the same end, but different start locations.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.LocationRelation.Inside
member.summary: This instance is inside the other range, and both start and end of this instance are inside the other range.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.LocationRelation.AdjacentBefore
member.summary: This instance occurs before, and is adjacent to, the other range.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.LocationRelation.OverlapsBefore
member.summary: This instance starts before the other range and overlaps its start.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.LocationRelation.Before
member.summary: This instance occurs before the other range.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.LocationRelation.AdjacentAfter
member.summary: This instance occurs after, and is adjacent to, the other range.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.LocationRelation.OverlapsAfter
member.summary: This instance starts inside the other range and overlaps its end.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.LocationRelation.After
member.summary: This instance occurs after the other range.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Run
member.summary:
Represents a contiguous fragment of a body content with uniform formatting.
Use to access the range of objects inside a run.
member.remarks: A run most commonly contains a single object, but it can also contain no or more than one texts and/or other objects.
member.example:
To get a string representing all text in a run:
string text = run.GetRange().Text;

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Tab
member.summary: Represents an absolute position tab element in a body content.
member.remarks:
An absolute position tab is a character that is used to advance the position on the current line of text when displaying content, using the following logic:
Regardless of any number of custom tab stops defined using the , the absolute position tab character shall advance to the position specified by its and properties.
The resulting end position of the tab character shall not be affected by the addition of any custom tab stops or changes to the value of the .
If the alignment location specified by the positional tab cannot be found on the current line because the starting location is past that point, then the tab character shall advance to that location on the next available line in the document.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ImageData.Crop
member.summary: Gets the portion of the image used for the fill.
member.remarks: Each edge of the source rectangle is defined by a percentage offset from the corresponding edge of the bounding box. A positive percentage specifies an inset, while a negative percentage specifies an outset. For example, a left offset of 25% specifies that the left edge of the source rectangle is located to the right of the bounding box's left edge by an amount equal to 25% of the bounding box's width.

member.summary:

If the image is linked, this method downloads the image each time it is called.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ImageData.ToStream
member.summary:
Creates and returns a stream containing the image bytes.
If the image bytes are stored in the picture, creates and returns a MemoryStream object.
If the image is linked and stored in a file, opens the file and returns a FileStream object.
If the image is linked and stored in an external URL, downloads the file and returns a MemoryStream object.
member.returns: A stream containing the image bytes.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ShapePosition.AllowOverlap
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether a shape that intersects another shape at display time is allowed to overlap the content of the other shape. If the shape cannot overlap other shape, it shall be repositioned when displayed to prevent this overlap as needed.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ShapePosition.Horizontal
member.summary: Gets the horizontal positioning of a floating shape within a document.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ShapePosition.LayoutInCell
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether a shape is positioned relative to a cell.
When this property is true, the shape is positioned within the existing table cell, causing the cell to be resized as needed. This means that all positioning is relative to the cell and not the line on which the table appears.
When this property is false, the shape is positioned as specified, but the table is resized and/or relocated within the document as needed to accommodate the object. This means that all positioning shall be relative to the line on which the table appears and not the cell in which the anchor is present.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ShapePosition.LockAnchor
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the anchor location for a shape shall not be modified at runtime when an application edits the contents of this document.
member.remarks: An application might have automatic behaviors that reposition the anchor for a shape based on user interaction - for example, moving it from one page to another as needed. This property must tell applications not to perform any such behaviors.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ShapePosition.Vertical
member.summary: Gets the vertical positioning of a floating shape within a document.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ShapePosition.ZOrder
member.summary:
Gets or sets the relative Z-order of a shape in a document.
Each floating shape has a Z-ordering value that determines which shape is displayed when any two objects intersect. Higher values indicate higher Z-order; lower values indicate lower Z-order.
member.remarks: This property only indicates the Z-order with respect to other shapes in the document that have an identical value. All shapes with a value of false are displayed above elements with a value of true.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ShapePosition.HasHorizontal
member.summary: Gets whether the horizontal positioning of the floating shape is used.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ShapePosition.HasVertical
member.summary: Gets whether the vertical positioning of the floating shape is used.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ShapeSize.EffectExtent
member.summary: Gets the additional extent that is added to each edge of a shape (top, bottom, left, right) in order to compensate for any drawing effects applied to the shape.
member.remarks: The and properties specify the size of the actual shape; however, an object can have effects applied that change its overall size, for example a reflection and/or shadow effect. The additional size for each edge of the shape is stored in this property, and used to calculate the appropriate wrapping for wrap types without a wrapping polygon and the appropriate line height for inline objects.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ShapeSize.Height
member.summary: Gets the final height (the result of any scaling to the original object) of a shape.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ShapeSize.Width
member.summary: Gets the final width (the result of any scaling to the original object) of a shape.

member.summary: Gets whether the additional extent is used.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ShapeSize.HasWidth

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.WrapType
member.summary: Specifies the wrap type of a shape.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.WrapType.Inline
member.summary: The shape is in line with the text, and affects the line height and layout of its line (like a character glyph of similar size)

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.WrapType.None
member.summary:
The shape does not cause any text wrapping within the document contents based on its display location. In effect, this value places the shape in one of two locations:
If the property is true, then the shape is positioned behind the text as it is normally displayed.
If the property is false, then the shape is positioned in front of the text as it is normally displayed.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.WrapType.Square
member.summary: Text wraps around a virtual rectangle bounding this shape.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.WrapType.Through
member.summary: Text wraps around the wrapping polygon bounding this shape and it allows text to wrap within the shape's maximum left and right extents.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.WrapType.Tight
member.summary: Text wraps around the wrapping polygon bounding this shape and it does not allow text to wrap within the shape's maximum left and right extents.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.WrapType.TopBottom
member.summary: Text wraps around the top and bottom of this shape, but not its left or right edges.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.WrapSide
member.summary:
Specifies how text wraps around the sides of a shape.
Specifies whether the document text should wrap on both sides of the shape, on either the left or right side only, or on the side of the shape that is farthest from the page margin.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.WrapSide.Both
member.summary: Text wraps on both sides of the shape.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.WrapSide.Left
member.summary: Text wraps on the left side of the shape only.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.WrapSide.Right
member.summary: Text wraps on the right side of the shape only.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.WrapSide.Largest
member.summary: Text wraps on the side of the shape that is farthest from the page margin.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.NotSupportedByWrapTypeException
member.summary: Exception that is thown if the current shape does not support this property.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.NotSupportedByWrapTypeException.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instannce of the class.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.WrapFormat
member.summary: Represents the properties for wrapping text around a shape or shape range.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.WrapFormat.#ctor
member.summary: Initalizes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.WrapFormat.BehindText
member.summary: Gets or sets whether a floating shape is displayed behind the text of the document when the document is displayed. When a shape is displayed within a document, that shape can intersect with text in the document. This property determines whether the text or the object is rendered on top in case of overlapping.
member.remarks: If property is not None, this value does not have any effect when displaying the object.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.WrapFormat.DistanceBottom
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum distance that is maintained between the bottom edge of a shape and any subsequent text within the document when this shape is displayed within the document's contents.
member.remarks: If property is Inline or None, then this value does not have any effect when displaying the object, but can be maintained and used if the object is subsequently changed to floating.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.WrapFormat.DistanceLeft
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum distance that is maintained between the left edge of the shape and any subsequent text within the document when this shape is displayed within the document's contents.
member.remarks: If property is Inline or None or TopBottom, this value does not have any effect when displaying the object, but can be maintained and used if the object is subsequently changed to floating.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.WrapFormat.DistanceRight
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum distance that is maintained between the right edge of the shape and any subsequent text within the document when this shape is displayed within the document's contents.
member.remarks: If property is Inline or None or TopBottom, this value does not have any effect when displaying the object, but can be maintained and used if the object is subsequently changed to floating.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.WrapFormat.DistanceTop
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum distance that is maintained between the top edge of the shape and any subsequent text within the document when this shape is displayed within the document's contents.
member.remarks: If property is Inline or None, this value does not have any effect when displaying the object, but can be maintained and used if the object is subsequently changed to floating.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.WrapFormat.Side
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the document text wraps on both sides of a shape, on either the left or right side only, or on the side of the shape that is farthest from the page margin.
member.remarks: If property is not Inline or None or TopBottom, his value does not have any effect when displaying the object.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.WrapFormat.Type
member.summary: Gets or sets the wrap type of a shape.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.WrapFormat.WrapPolygon
member.summary: Gets or sets the wrapping polygon that is used to determine the extents to which text can wrap around the shape in the document.

member.param: A parent key for the formatting properties in this object.

Parent base keys to synchronize formatting properties in this object.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Border.FrameEffect
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the specified border should be modified to create a frame effect by reversing the border's appearance from the edge nearest the text to the edge furthest from the text.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Border.Color
member.summary: Gets or sets the border color.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Border.LineStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the line style.
member.remarks: If you set the line style to none, the line width is automatically changed to zero. This border can either be an art border (a repeated image along the borders shall only be used for page borders) or a line border (a line format repeated along the borders).

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Border.LineWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the border width in points.
member.remarks: If you set line width greater than zero when line style is none, the line style is automatically changed to single line.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Border.Shadow
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the border has a shadow.
member.remarks: In Microsoft Word, for a border to have a shadow, the borders on all four sides should be of the same type, width, color and all should have the Shadow property set to true.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Border.Space
member.summary:
Gets or sets the distance of the border from text or from the page edge in points.
Has no effect and will be automatically reset to zero for borders of table cells.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Border.Visible
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the border is visible.
If set to false, the the line style is is automatically changed to LineStyle.None.

member.summary: Resets border properties to default values.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.WordColor.RGB
member.summary:
Gets or sets the RGB color value. The value indicates auto color. Only solid colors (with alpha 255) are supported.
If this property is set to a value other than , , and property values are removed.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.WordColor.ThemeColor
member.summary: Gets or sets a theme color that should be applied to the current object.
member.remarks: The specified theme color is a reference to one of the predefined theme colors, located in the document themes, which allows for color information to be set centrally in the document.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.WordColor.ThemeShade
member.summary: Gets or sets the shade value applied to the supplied theme color (if any) for this contents.
member.remarks: If the ThemeShade is supplied, then it is applied to the RGB value of the theme color to determine the final color applied to this contents.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.WordColor.ThemeTint
member.summary: Gets or sets the tint value applied to the supplied theme color (if any) for this contents.
member.remarks: If the ThemeTint is supplied, then it is applied to the RGB value of the theme color to determine the final color applied to this contents.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.WordColor.ClearFormatting
member.summary: Resets to default color formatting.
member.remarks: Removes all font formatting specified explicitly on the object from which Color was obtained so the color formatting will be inherited from the appropriate parent.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Ligatures.Standard
member.summary: Applies standard ligatures to the font. Standard ligatures are designed to enhance readability. Standard ligatures in Latin languages include "fi", "fl", and "ff", for example.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Ligatures.Contextual
member.summary: Applies contextual ligatures to the font. Contextual ligatures are often designed to enhance readability, but may also be solely ornamental. Contextual ligatures may also be contextual alternates.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Ligatures.Historical
member.summary: Applies historical ligatures to the font. Historical ligatures are similar to standard ligatures in that they were originally intended to improve the readability of the font, but may look archaic to the modern reader.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Ligatures.Discretional

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Font
member.summary: Represents font attributes (font name, size, color, and so on) for an object.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Font.#ctor(GrapeCity.Documents.Word.IFormatting,System.String)
member.summary: Initalizes a new instance of the class.
member.param: A parent key for the formatting properties in this object.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Font.ContextualAlternates
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether contextual alternates are enabled for the font.
member.remarks: Contextual alternates are ligatures that are applied to individual characters based on the letters around them (their context). Contextual alternates can also be applied to entire words in certain contexts, for example, words frequently used in titles (such as "of" and "the"). When contextual alternates are enabled for a font, they are used instead of the standard ligatures in those contexts defined by the font designer.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Font.HighlightColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the highlight (marker) color.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Font.Ligatures
member.summary: Gets or sets ligatures that are two or more glyphs that are represented by what appears to the reader as a single character in order to create more readable or attractive text.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Font.NumberForm
member.summary: Gets or sets the number form setting for an OpenType font.
member.remarks: Numbers in OpenType fonts can be displayed either with consistent heights along the baseline of the text (called "lining"), or with varying heights (called "hanging" or "old style") where numbers are displayed above or below the baseline of the text. Use the NumberForm property to specify whether numbers are displayed using lining or old-style.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Font.NumberSpacing
member.summary: Gets or sets the number spacing setting for a font.
member.remarks: OpenType fonts support a proportional and tabular figure feature to control number spacing. Proportional number spacing handles each number as having a different width. For example, "1" is displayed as narrower than "5". Tabular number spacing handles numbers as equal in width so that they align vertically, which increases the readability, especially for financial information.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Font.RightToLeft
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the contents shall have right-to-left characteristics.
member.remarks: This property, when on, shall not be used with strongly left-to-right text. Any behavior under that condition is unspecified. This property, when off, shall not be used with strong right-to-left text. Any behavior under that condition is unspecified. When the contents of this run are displayed, all characters shall be treated as complex script characters for formatting purposes. This means that BoldBi, ItalicBi, SizeBi and a corresponding font name will be used when rendering the content.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Font.StylisticSets
member.summary: Gets or sets the stylistic set for the specified font.
member.remarks: Some OpenType fonts provide stylistic sets. A stylistic set defines a set of characters within the font that are intended to be used together, usually for the purpose of visual harmony, such as in headings.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Font.ClearFormatting
member.summary: Resets to default font formatting.
member.remarks: Removes all font formatting specified explicitly on the object from which Font was obtained so the font formatting will be inherited from the appropriate parent.

member.summary: Contains font attributes (font name, font size, color, and so on) for an object.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.FontBase.#ctor(GrapeCity.Documents.Word.IFormatting,System.String)
member.summary: Initalizes a new instance of the class.
member.param: A parent key for the formatting properties in this object.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.FontBase.#ctor(GrapeCity.Documents.Word.IFormatting,System.String,System.String[])
member.summary: Initalizes a new instance of the class.
member.param: A parent key for the formatting properties in this object.
Parent base keys to synchronize formatting properties in this object.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.FontBase.AllCaps
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the font is formatted as all capital letters.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.FontBase.AlwaysHidden
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the given run shall always behave as if it is hidden, even when hidden text is being displayed in the current document.
member.remarks: This property shall only be used to specify that a paragraph mark shall never be used to break the end of a paragraph for display, even if it is being shown on the document, as would be the case if a regularly hidden paragraph was not being displayed in the document. This property was typically used to ensure that a paragraph style can be applied to a part of a paragraph, and still appear as in the Table of Contents (which in previous word processors would ignore the use of the style if it were being used as a character style. If this font property is applied to any other run, it can be ignored.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.FontBase.Animation
member.summary: Gets or sets the font animation effect.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.FontBase.Bidi
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the contents shall be treated as complex script text regardless of their Unicode character values when determining the formatting. This means that a consumer shall use the complex script formatting (e.g. BoldBi, ItalicBi...) applied by this font when determining the resulting formatting properties.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.FontBase.Bold
member.summary: a value indicating whether the font is formatted as bold.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.FontBase.BoldBi
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the bold property shall be applied to all complex script characters in the contents when displayed in a document.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.FontBase.Border
member.summary: Gets the object that specifies borders for the font.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.FontBase.Color
member.summary: Gets the color of the font.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.FontBase.DisableCharacterSpaceGrid
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the current run should use the document grid characters per line settings defined in the Document.Grid property when laying out the contents in this run. This setting determines whether the additional character pitch specified in the document grid shall be added to each character in this run as specified by the document grid.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.FontBase.DoubleStrikeThrough
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the font is formatted as double strikethrough text.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.FontBase.EastAsianLayout
member.summary: Gets East Asian typography settings which shall be applied to the contents of the run.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.FontBase.Emboss
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the font is formatted as embossed.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.FontBase.EmphasisMark
member.summary: Gets or sets a constant that represents the emphasis mark for a character or designated character string.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.FontBase.Engrave
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the font is formatted as engraved.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.FontBase.FitTextWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets that the contents of the run shall not be automatically displayed based on the width of its contents, rather its contents shall be resized to fit the width specified by the this property. This expansion/contraction shall be performed by equally increasing/decreasing the size of each character in the run's contents when displayed.
member.remarks: If the property value equals to 0, then the contents of the run shall be displayed based on the size of its contents.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.FontBase.FitTextId
member.summary: Gets or sets a unique ID which shall be used to link multiple contiguous runs with specified property to each other to ensure that their contents are correctly merged into the specified width in the document. This means that multiple runs which are broken apart due to differences in formatting can be identified as belonging to the same grouping in terms of FitText properties, although they are multiple runs of text in the document.
member.remarks: If this property value equals to 0, then the run has no id and shall not be linked with any other run in the parent paragraph.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.FontBase.Hidden
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the font is formatted as hidden text.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.FontBase.HintType
member.summary: Gets or sets the font type that shall be used to format any ambiguous characters.
member.remarks: There are certain characters that are not explicitly stored in the document, and can be mapped into multiple categories of the four mentioned above. This property shall be used to arbitrate that conflict, and determine how ambiguities shall be handled. This is primarily used to handle the formatting on the paragraph mark glyph, and other characters that are not stored as text.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.FontBase.Italic
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the font is formatted as italic.

member.summary: Gets or sets the font size at which kerning starts.

member.summary:
Gets or sets the name of the font.
When getting, returns by default. If is returns . If is returns . When setting, sets , , and to the specified value.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.FontBase.NameAscii
member.summary: Gets or sets the font used for Latin text (characters with character codes from 0 (zero) through 127).

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.FontBase.NameBi
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the font used for complex script characters.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.FontBase.NameFarEast
member.summary: Gets or sets an East Asian font name.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.FontBase.NameOther
member.summary: Gets or sets the font used for characters with character codes from 128 through 255.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.FontBase.NoProofing
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the formatted characters are not to be spell checked.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.FontBase.Outline
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the font is formatted as outline.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.FontBase.Position
member.summary: Gets or sets the position of text (in points) relative to the base line. A positive number raises the text, and a negative number lowers it.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.FontBase.Scaling
member.summary: Gets or sets the character width scaling in percent.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.FontBase.Shading
member.summary: Gets the object that refers to the shading formatting for the font.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.FontBase.Shadow
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the font is formatted as shadowed.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.FontBase.Size
member.summary: Gets or sets the font size in points.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.FontBase.SizeBi
member.summary: Gets or sets the font size in points used for all complex script characters in the contents when displayed in a document.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.FontBase.SmallCaps
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the font is formatted as small capital letters.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.FontBase.Spacing
member.summary: Gets or sets the spacing (in points) between characters.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.FontBase.StrikeThrough
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the font is formatted as strikethrough text.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.FontBase.VerticalPosition
member.summary: Gets or set the alignment that shall be applied to the contents in relation to the default appearance of the text. This allows the text to be repositioned as subscript or superscript without altering the font size.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.FontBase.ThemeAscii
member.summary: Gets or sets a theme font that shall be used to format all characters in the Unicode range (U+0000U+007F) within the parent. This theme font is a reference to one of the predefined theme fonts, which allows for font information to be set centrally in the document.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.FontBase.ThemeBi
member.summary: Gets or sets a theme font that shall be used to format all characters in a complex script Unicode range. This theme font is a reference to one of the predefined theme fonts, which allows for font information to be set centrally in the document.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.FontBase.ThemeFarEast
member.summary: Gets or sets a theme font that shall be used to format all characters in an East Asian Unicode range. This theme font is a reference to one of the predefined theme fonts, which allows for font information to be set centrally in the document.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.FontBase.ThemeOther
member.summary: Gets or sets a theme font that shall be used to format all characters in a Unicode range that does not fall into one of the three categories defined above. This theme font is a reference to one of the predefined theme fonts, which allows for font information to be set centrally in the document.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.FontBase.Underline
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of underline applied to the font.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.FontBase.UnderlineColor
member.summary: Gets the color of the underline applied to the font.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.FontBase.WebHidden
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the contents shall be hidden in a document when the document is being displayed in a web page view.
member.remarks: The setting should affect the normal display of text in a web page view, but an application can have settings to force hidden text to be displayed. As well, this setting should not affect a normal paginated view of the document.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.FontBase.ClearFormatting
member.summary: Resets to default font formatting.
member.remarks: Removes all font formatting specified explicitly on the object from which Font was obtained so the font formatting will be inherited from the appropriate parent.

member.summary: Represents a single list level, either the only level for a bulleted or numbered list or one of the nine levels of an outline numbered list.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Gets character formatting used for the list label.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ListLevel.Index
member.summary: Gets the level index in the parent .

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ListLevel.IsLegal
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the level turns all inherited numbers to Arabic. The false value preserves their number style.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ListLevel.LinkedStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the paragraph style that is linked to this list level.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ListLevel.ListTemplate
member.summary: Gets the parent .

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ListLevel.NumberFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the number format for the list level.
member.remarks:
The percent sign (%) followed by any number from 1 through 9 represents the number style from the respective list level.
For example, if you wanted the format for the first level to be "Article I," "Article II," and so on, the string for the property would be "Article %1" and the property would be set to .
If the property is set to , the string for the property can only contain one character.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ListLevel.NumberPosition
member.summary: Gets or sets the position (in points) of the number or bullet for the list level.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ListLevel.NumberStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the number style for this list level.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ListLevel.CustomNumberStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets a custom number format using the syntax defined by the XSLT 1.0 format attribute.
member.example: A value of ア indicates that a consumer must use Katakana numbering.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ListLevel.ParagraphFormat
member.summary: Gets the paragraph properties that are applied as part of a given numbering level.
member.remarks: These paragraph properties are applied to any numbered paragraph that references this list level. Paragraph properties specified on the numbered paragraph itself override the paragraph properties specified in this list level.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ListLevel.PictureBullet
member.summary: Gets or sets image data of the picture bullet shape for the current list level.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ListLevel.RestartAfterLevel
member.summary:
Gets or sets the list level that must appear before the specified list level restarts numbering.
The value of 0 means the numbering continues sequentially each time the list level appears.

member.summary: Gets or sets the starting number for this list level.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.BuiltInListTemplateId
member.summary: Specifies predefined list templates available in Microsoft Word.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.BuiltInListTemplateId.BulletDefault
member.summary: Default bulleted list with 9 levels. Bullet of the first level is a disc, bullet of the second level is a circle, bullet of the third level is a square. Then formatting repeats for the remaining levels. Each level is indented to the right by 18 points relative to the previous level. Corresponds to the 1st bulleted list template in the Bullets and Numbering dialog box in Microsoft Word.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.BuiltInListTemplateId.BulletCircle
member.summary: The bullet of the first level is a circle. The remaining levels are same as in BulletDefault. Corresponds to the 2nd bulleted list template in the Bullets and Numbering dialog box in Microsoft Word.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.BuiltInListTemplateId.BulletSquare
member.summary: The bullet of the first level is a square. The remaining levels are same as in BulletDefault. Corresponds to the 3rd bulleted list template in the Bullets and Numbering dialog box in Microsoft Word.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.BuiltInListTemplateId.BulletPicture
member.summary: The bullet of the first level is a picture. The remaining levels are same as in BulletDefault. Corresponds to the 3rd bulleted list template in the Bullets and Numbering dialog box in Microsoft Word.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.BuiltInListTemplateId.BulletDiamonds
member.summary: The bullet of the first level is a 4-diamond Wingding character. The remaining levels are same as in BulletDefault. Corresponds to the 5th bulleted list template in the Bullets and Numbering dialog box in Microsoft Word.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.BuiltInListTemplateId.BulletArrowHead
member.summary: The bullet of the first level is an arrow head Wingding character. The remaining levels are same as in BulletDefault. Corresponds to the 6th bulleted list template in the Bullets and Numbering dialog box in Microsoft Word.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.BuiltInListTemplateId.BulletTick
member.summary: The bullet of the first level is a tick Wingding character. The remaining levels are same as in BulletDefault. Corresponds to the 7th bulleted list template in the Bullets and Numbering dialog box in Microsoft Word.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.BuiltInListTemplateId.NumberDefault
member.summary: Default numbered list with 9 levels. Arabic numbering (1., 2., 3., ...) for the first level, lowecase letter numbering (a., b., c., ...) for the second level, lowercase roman numbering (i., ii., iii., ...) for the third level. Then formatting repeats for the remaining levels. Each level is indented to the right by 18 points relative to the previous level. Corresponds to the 1st numbered list template in the Bullets and Numbering dialog box in Microsoft Word.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.BuiltInListTemplateId.NumberArabicParenthesis
member.summary: The number of the first level is "1)". The remaining levels are same as in NumberDefault. Corresponds to the 2nd numbered list template in the Bullets and Numbering dialog box in Microsoft Word.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.BuiltInListTemplateId.NumberUppercaseRomanDot
member.summary: The number of the first level is "I.". The remaining levels are same as in NumberDefault. Corresponds to the 3rd numbered list template in the Bullets and Numbering dialog box in Microsoft Word.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.BuiltInListTemplateId.NumberUppercaseLetterDot
member.summary: The number of the first level is "A.". The remaining levels are same as in NumberDefault. Corresponds to the 4th numbered list template in the Bullets and Numbering dialog box in Microsoft Word.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.BuiltInListTemplateId.NumberLowercaseLetterParenthesis
member.summary: The number of the first level is "a)". The remaining levels are same as in NumberDefault. Corresponds to the 5th numbered list template in the Bullets and Numbering dialog box in Microsoft Word.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.BuiltInListTemplateId.NumberLowercaseLetterDot
member.summary: The number of the first level is "a.". The remaining levels are same as in NumberDefault. Corresponds to the 6th numbered list template in the Bullets and Numbering dialog box in Microsoft Word.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.BuiltInListTemplateId.NumberLowercaseRomanDot
member.summary: The number of the first level is "i.". The remaining levels are same as in NumberDefault. Corresponds to the 7th numbered list template in the Bullets and Numbering dialog box in Microsoft Word.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.BuiltInListTemplateId.OutlineNumbers
member.summary: An outline list with levels numbered "1), a), i), (1), (a), (i), 1., a., i.". Corresponds to the 1st outline list template in the Bullets and Numbering dialog box in Microsoft Word.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.BuiltInListTemplateId.OutlineLegal
member.summary: An outline list with levels are numbered "1., 1.1., 1.1.1, ...". Corresponds to the 2nd outline list template in the Bullets and Numbering dialog box in Microsoft Word.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.BuiltInListTemplateId.OutlineBullets
member.summary: An outline lists with various bullets for different levels. Corresponds to the 3nd outline list template in the Bullets and Numbering dialog box in Microsoft Word.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.BuiltInListTemplateId.OutlineHeadingsArticleSection
member.summary: An outline list with levels linked to Heading styles. Corresponds to the 4th outline list template in the Bullets and Numbering dialog box in Microsoft Word.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.BuiltInListTemplateId.OutlineHeadingsLegal
member.summary: An outline list with levels linked to Heading styles. Corresponds to the 5th outline list template in the Bullets and Numbering dialog box in Microsoft Word.

member.summary: An outline list with levels linked to Heading styles. Corresponds to the 6th outline list template in the Bullets and Numbering dialog box in Microsoft Word.

member.summary: An outline list with levels linked to Heading styles. Corresponds to the 7th outline list template in the Bullets and Numbering dialog box in Microsoft Word.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ListTemplate.StyleDefinition
member.summary: Gets a numbering style that this list template uses as the base numbering definition.
member.remarks: Numbering styles are never directly referenced by paragraphs or runs in the document. Instead, a list template specifies that it contains the underlying numbering information for a numbering style. The numbering style itself is just a friendly name on a list template.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ListTemplate.StyleReference
member.summary: Gets a numbering style that serves the actual numbering properties, and which itself points to the actual underlying list template.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ListTemplate.AbstractId
member.summary: Gets or sets a unique number that shall be used as the identifier for the abstract numbering definition of this list template.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ListTemplate.InitialAbstractId
member.summary: Gets or sets a unique ID for the abstract numbering definition of this list template. This number shall be identical for two abstract numbering definitions that are based from the same initial numbering definition if a document is repurposed and the underlying numbering definition is changed, it shall maintain its original InitialAbstractId.
member.remarks: This property can be used to determine the abstract numbering definition to be applied to a numbered paragraph copied from one document and pasted into another. Consider a case in which a given numbered paragraph associated with a abstract numbering definition 123, is pasted among numbered paragraphs associated with a completely different appearance and an abstract numbering definition 123. Here, because of the distinction enabled by the identical values, the hosting application would not have to arbitrarily keep the pasted numbered paragraph associated with its original abstract numbering definition, as it might use the information provided by the abstract numbering definition's identical values to know that those two numbering sets are identical, and merge the paragraphs into the target numbering format.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ListTemplate.Code
member.summary: Gets os sets a unique code that can be used to determine a location within application user interface in which this list template shall be displayed.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ListTemplate.StyleDefinitionId
member.summary: Gets or sets that the list template is the base numbering definition for the specified referenced numbering style.
member.remarks: Numbering styles are never directly referenced by paragraphs or runs in the document instead, a list template specifies that it contains the underlying numbering information for a numbering style. The numbering style itself is just a friendly name on a list template. If this property is not defined, or it references a style that does not exist, then this list template shall not be the underlying properties for a numbering style.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ListTemplate.StyleRefenceId
member.summary: Gets or sets that the list template does not contain the actual numbering properties, but rather serves as a reference to a numbering style stored in the document, that shall be applied when this list template is referenced, and itself points at the actual underlying list template to be used.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ListTemplateCollection.LastReviewedAbstructId
member.summary: Gets or sets to a consumer the progress in the last attempt made by the application to remove unused abstract definitions from the document. If a legacy document is opened by a consumer, it can choose to remove abstract definition which are 'orphaned' (have no associated numbering definition instances). This property is used by those consumers to indicate their progress (if not complete) in reviewing existing abstract numbering definitions.
member.remarks: Removing unused abstract numbering definition from a document reduces the file size, but is not required.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ListTemplateCollection.Abstracts
member.summary: Gets the array of abstracted list templates.
member.remarks: Each abstruct template specifies a set of properties which shall dictate the appearance and behavior of a set of numbered paragraphs in a document. These properties are collectively called an abstract numbering definition, and are the basis for all numbering information in a document. Although an abstract numbering definition contains a complete set of numbering, it shall not be directly referenced by content(hence the use of abstract). Instead, these properties shall be inherited by a numbering definition instance, which can then itself be referenced by content.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Indentation
member.summary: Represents the set of indentation properties applied to a paragraph.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Indentation.#ctor(GrapeCity.Documents.Word.IFormatting,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: A parent key for the formatting properties in this object.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Indentation.AutoAdjustRightIndent
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the right indent shall be automatically adjusted for the given paragraph when a document grid has been defined for the current section, modifying of the current right indent used on this paragraph.
member.remarks: This setting is used in order to ensure that the line breaking for that paragraph is not determined by the width of the final character on the line.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Indentation.CharacterUnitFirstLineIndent
member.summary: Returns or sets the value (in characters) for a first-line or hanging indent. Use a positive value to set a first-line indent, and use a negative value to set a hanging indent.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Indentation.CharacterUnitLeftIndent
member.summary: Gets or sets the left indent value (in characters) for the specified paragraphs.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Indentation.CharacterUnitRightIndent
member.summary: Gets or sets the right indent value (in characters) for the specified paragraphs.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Indentation.FirstLineIndent
member.summary: Gets or sets the value (in points) for a first line or hanging indent. Use a positive value to set a first-line indent, and use a negative value to set a hanging indent.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Indentation.LeftIndent
member.summary: Gets or sets the value (in points) that represents the left indent for paragraph.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Indentation.MirrorIndents
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the paragraph indents should be interpreted as mirrored indents.
member.remarks: When true, the start indent shall become the inside indent (the one closest to the binding) and the end indent shall become the outside indent (the one furthest from the binding). This mirroring is typically used when the contents of the document are used to generate signatures combinations of pages that are then placed in a binding. When signatures are printed in a left-to-right document, the first, third, etc. pages are printed on the left side of the combined sheet, and the second, fourth, etc. are printed on its right side, then bound and folded. For a right-to-left document, the first, third, etc. pages are printed on the right side of the combined sheet, and the second, fourth, etc. are printed on its left side.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Indentation.RightIndent
member.summary: Gets or sets the value (in points) that represents the right indent for paragraph.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Indentation.ClearFormatting
member.summary: Resets to default indent formatting.
member.remarks: Removes all indent formatting specified explicitly on the object from which Indent was obtained so the indent formatting will be inherited from the appropriate parent.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ParagraphFormat
member.summary: Represents all formatting for a paragraph.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ParagraphFormat.#ctor(GrapeCity.Documents.Word.IFormatting,System.String)
member.summary: Initialzes a new instance of the class.
member.param: A parent key for the formatting properties in this object.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ParagraphFormat.Alignment
member.summary: Gets or sets text alignment for the paragraph.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ParagraphFormat.BaseLineAlignment
member.summary: Gets or sets the vertical alignment of all text on each line displayed within a paragraph. If the line height (before any added spacing) is larger than one or more characters on the line, all characters are aligned to each other as specified by this property.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ParagraphFormat.Bidi
member.summary: Gets or sets whether this is a right-to-left paragraph.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ParagraphFormat.Borders
member.summary: Gets border collection of the paragraph.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ParagraphFormat.DisableLineHeightGrid
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the current paragraph should use the document grid lines per page settings defined in the document when laying out the contents in the paragraph. This setting determines whether the additional line pitch specified in the document grid shall be added to each line in this paragraph as specified by the document grid.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ParagraphFormat.Indentation
member.summary: Gets the set of indentation properties applied to the current paragraph.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ParagraphFormat.FarEastLineBreakControl
member.summary: Gets or sets whether East Asian typography and line-breaking rules shall be applied to text in this paragraph to determine which characters can begin and end each line. This property only applies to Simplified Chinese, Traditional Chinese, and Japanese text in this paragraph.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ParagraphFormat.HalfWidthPunctuationOnTopOfLine
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to change punctuation symbols at the beginning of a line to half-width characters for the paragraphs

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ParagraphFormat.HangingPunctuation
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the text in this paragraph shall be allowed to extend one character beyond the extents applied by any indents/margins when the character that extends past those extents is a punctuation character.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ParagraphFormat.Hyphenation
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the current paragraph should be exempted from any hyphenation that is applied in the document settings.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ParagraphFormat.KeepTogether
member.summary: True if all lines in the paragraph are to remain on the same page.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ParagraphFormat.KeepWithNext
member.summary: True if the paragraph is to remains on the same page as the paragraph that follows it.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ParagraphFormat.NoLineNumber
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the current paragraph's lines should be exempted from line numbering that is applied in the parent section.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ParagraphFormat.OutlineLevel
member.summary: Specifies the outline level of the paragraph in the document.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ParagraphFormat.PageBreakBefore
member.summary: True if a page break is forced before the paragraph.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ParagraphFormat.TextFlowDirection
member.summary: Gets or sets the reading order of the specified paragraphs without changing their alignment.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ParagraphFormat.Shading
member.summary: Returns a Shading object that refers to the shading formatting for the paragraph.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ParagraphFormat.Spacing
member.summary: Gets the set of spacing properties applied to the current paragraph.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ParagraphFormat.TabStops
member.summary: Gets the collection of custom tab stops defined for this object.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ParagraphFormat.TextboxTightWrap
member.summary: Gets or sets whether, for paragraphs in a text box, the surrounding text shall be allowed to overlap with the empty text box boundaries and tight wrap to the extents of the text within the text box.
member.remarks: This property has only effect for paragraphs that are contained within a text box, ignored otherwise.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ParagraphFormat.WidowControl
member.summary: True if the first and last lines in the paragraph are to remain on the same page as the rest of the paragraph.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ParagraphFormat.WordWrap
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to wrap Latin text in the middle of a word in the paragraph.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ParagraphFormat.ClearFormatting
member.summary: Resets to default paragraph formatting.
member.remarks: Default paragraph formatting is Normal style, left aligned, no indentation, no spacing, no borders and no shading.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ParagraphFormat.ListFormat
member.summary: Get a list formatting specified for the paragraph formatting.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ParagraphFormat.ListParagraphFormatting
member.summary: Gets the list level direct formatting specified for the paragraph formatting.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ParagraphFormat.ConditionalStyleOptions
member.summary: Specifies the set of conditional table style formatting properties that have been applied to content.
member.remarks: This enumeration is an optimization that is used by consumers to determine if a given property on a content is the result of the table style conditional formatting properties vs. direct formatting on the table cell itself. It specifies the components of the conditional formatting in the table style applied to this content, so that the table's conditional formatting can be applied after the document is displayed without having the table style properties override the style hierarchy.

member.summary: Specifies the set of properties applied to the glyph used to represent the physical location of the paragraph mark for this paragraph. member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.LineSpacingRule
member.summary: Specifies line spacing values for a paragraph.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.LineSpacingRule.Auto
member.summary: Automatically determined line height.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.LineSpacingRule.Exact
member.summary: The line spacing never changes from the value specified in the property, even if a larger font is used within the paragraph.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.LineSpacingRule.AtLeast
member.summary: The line spacing can be greater than or equal to, but never less than, the value specified in the property.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Spacing
member.summary: Specifies the set of indentation properties applied to the current paragraph.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Spacing.#ctor(GrapeCity.Documents.Word.IFormatting,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: A parent key for the formatting properties in this object.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Spacing.AddSpaceBetweenFarEastAndAlpha
member.summary: Gets or sets whether inter-character spacing shall automatically be adjusted between regions of Latin text and regions of East Asian text in the current paragraph. These regions shall be determined by the Unicode character values of the text content within the paragraph.
member.remarks: This property is used to ensure that the spacing between regions of Latin text and adjoining East Asian text is sufficient on each side such that the Latin text can be easily read within the East Asian text.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Spacing.AddSpaceBetweenFarEastAndDigit
member.summary: Gets or sets whether inter-character spacing shall automatically be adjusted between regions of numbers and regions of East Asian text in the current paragraph. These regions shall be determined by the Unicode character values of the text content within the paragraph.
member.remarks: This property is used to ensure that the spacing between regions of numbers and adjoining East Asian text is sufficient on each side such that the numbers can be easily read within the East Asian text.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Spacing.LineSpacing
member.summary: Gets or sets the line spacing for the paragraph. If is Auto then value is interpreted in lines otherwise in points.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Spacing.LineSpacingRule
member.summary: Gets or sets the line spacing rule for the paragraph.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Spacing.NoSpaceBetweenParagraphsOfSameStyle
member.summary: When true, and will be ignored between the paragraphs of the same style.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Spacing.LineUnitAfter
member.summary:
Gets or sets the amount of spacing (in gridlines) after the paragraph.
Has no effect when is true.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Spacing.LineUnitBefore
member.summary:
Gets or sets the amount of spacing (in gridlines) before the paragraph.
Has no effect when is true.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Spacing.SpaceAfter
member.summary:
Gets or sets the amount of spacing (in points) after the paragraph.
Has no effect when is true.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Spacing.SpaceAfterAuto
member.summary:
True if the amount of spacing after the paragraph is set automatically.
When set to true, overrides the effect of .

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Spacing.SpaceBefore
member.summary:
Gets or sets the amount of spacing (in points) before the paragraph.
Has no effect when is true.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Spacing.SpaceBeforeAuto
member.summary:
True if the amount of spacing before the paragraph is set automatically.
When set to true, overrides the effect of .

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Spacing.ClearFormatting
member.summary:
Resets to default spacing formatting.
Removes all spacing formatting specified explicitly on the object from which Indent was obtained so the spacing formatting will be inherited from the appropriate parent.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.PageNumbering
member.summary: Represents page numbering settings for all page numbers that appear in the contents of a section.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.PageNumbering.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.PageNumbering.IncludeChapterNumber
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether a chapter number is included with page numbers or a caption label.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.PageNumbering.ChapterPageSeparator
member.summary:
Gets or sets the separator character used between the chapter number and the page number.
If the property is 0, or its specified heading level does not have an associated numbering format, this value is ignored, since no chapter number is output by the field.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.PageNumbering.HeadingLevelForChapter
member.summary:
Gets or sets the one-based index of the heading style applied to chapter titles in the document, to be used as chapter headings in all page numbers for a section, by locating the nearest heading of that style and extracting the numbering information.
Can be a number from 0 through 8, corresponding to heading levels 1 through 9.
member.remarks: If the specified heading style does not exist in the current section, or does not have a numbering format, then any previous level heading format shall be used as needed as the specified chapter number. If no heading has numbering information and/or is used in the section, then the chapter and chapter separator shall be omitted from the page numbering data.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.PageNumbering.NumberStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the page number format.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.PageNumbering.StartingNumber
member.summary:
Gets or sets the starting page number of a section.
The property, if set to false, will override this property so that page numbering can continue from the previous section.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.PageNumbering.RestartPageNumbering
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether page numbering restarts at the beginning of a section.
If false, overrides the property so that page numbering can continue from the previous section.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.LatentStyle.Locked
member.summary: Gets or sets whether an application shall prevent the use of this style when this document is loaded and/or modified. If true then this style can be used to format existing content (i.e. any content which references this style shall have its properties as normal), but new instances of the style shall be prevented from being applied via all mechanisms associated with that application.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.LatentStyle.QuickStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets whether this style shall be treated as a primary style when this document is loaded by an application. If true then this style has been designated as being particularly important for the current document, and this information can be used by an application in any means desired.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.LatentStyle.UnhideWhenUsed
member.summary: Gets or sets whether this style should not be displayed in any main user interface associated with an application which processes this document until it is referenced by document content.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether an application shall automatically modify this style when the contents of an entire paragraph in the document with this style applied are modified, ensuring that although only a single instance of text with this style was modified, that change is stored on the style and therefore propagated to all locations where the style is in use.

member.summary: Get a value indicating whether the built-in style has been modified or applied in the document or it is a new style that has been created in the document.

member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether a style is a linked style that can be used for both paragraph and character formatting.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Style.LinkStyle
member.summary:
Gets the style linked to the current style.
Styles can be paired to comprise a linked style.
A linked style is a grouping of a paragraph style and a character style that is used in a user interface to allow the same set of formatting properties to be applied.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Style.ListTemplate
member.summary:
Gets the that defines list foratting for the list style.
This property is only valid for list styles. For other style types this property returns null.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Style.ListFormat
member.summary:
Get a list formatting for the paragraph style.
This property is only valid for paragraph styles. For other style types this property returns null.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Style.Locked
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether an application shall prevent the use of this style when this document is loaded and/or modified.
If true, this style can be used to format existing content (i.e. any content that references this style shall have its properties as normal), but new instances of the style shall be prevented from being applied via all mechanisms associated with that application.

member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the style.

member.summary: Gets the paragraph formatting of the style.

member.summary: A number that can be used to sort the set of style definitions in a user interface.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Style.RevisionId
member.summary:
Gets or sets unique identifiers used to track style editing session.
A producer can choose to increment the revision save ID value to indicate subsequent editing (editing between save actions) to indicate the order of the saves performed.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Style.UnhideWhenUsed
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether shall be reset when this style is used by the content of the document.
If true, an application shall ensure that even if the is that this property should be considered as if the style is referenced by any content in the document.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Style.Delete
member.summary: Deletes the style from the document.
member.remarks:
Style removal has following effects on the document model:
All references to the style are removed from corresponding paragraphs, runs and tables.
If a base style is removed, its formatting is moved to child styles.
If the style to be deleted has a linked style, then both styles are deleted.

member.summary: Do not use this constructor for this class directly, use it only in derived classes.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.TableStyleBase.Alignment
member.summary: Gets or sets the alignment of an inline table in the document.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.TableStyleBase.AllowBreakAcrossPages
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the content within the cells can be rendered on multiple pages.
member.remarks: When displaying the contents of a table cell, it is possible that a page break would fall within the contents of a table cell, causing the contents of that cell to be displayed across two different pages. If this property is false, then all contents of a table row shall be rendered on the same page by moving the start of the current row to the start of a new page if necessary. If the contents of this table row cannot fit on a single page, then this row shall start on a new page and flow onto multiple pages as necessary.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.TableStyleBase.HeadingFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether a table row shall be repeated at the top of each new page on which part of this table is displayed. This gives this table row the behavior of a 'header' row on each of these pages.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.TableStyleBase.Indent
member.summary: Gets or sets the indentation (in points) that shall be added before the leading edge of the current table.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.TableStyleBase.Padding
member.summary: Gets the default paddings for all cells in the current table.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.TableStyleBase.Shading
member.summary: Gets the shading that shall be applied to the extents of a table. Similarly to paragraph shading, this shading shall be applied to the contents of the tab up to the table borders, regardless of the presence of text - unlike cell shading, table shading shall include any cell padding. This property shall be superseded by any cell-level shading.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.TableStyleBase.Spacing
member.summary: Gets or sets the default amount of space (in points) between the cells.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to fit text in a cell, compressing each paragraph to the width of the cell.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.CellFormat.HorizontalMerge
member.summary: Gets or sets a value specifying how a cell is merged horizontally with other cells in the row.
member.remarks: This property is maintained for compatibility with legacy word documents that defined tables in this manner. Whenever possible, this form or horizontal merges should not be used, and should be translated to the appropriate property instead.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.CellFormat.Padding
member.summary: Gets the cell paddings for a cell.

member.summary: Gets or sets the preferred width of a cell.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.CellFormat.TextFlowDirection
member.summary: Gets or sets the orientation of text in a cell.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.CellFormat.Shading
member.summary: Gets shading formatting for a cell.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.CellFormat.VerticalAlignment
member.summary: Gets or sets the vertical alignment of text in a cell.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.CellFormat.VerticalMerge
member.summary: Gets or sets a value specifying how a cell is merged with other cells vertically.
member.remarks: Cells can only be merged vertically if their left and right boundaries are identical. When cells are vertically merged, the display areas of the merged cells are consolidated. The consolidated area is used to display the contents of the first vertically merged cell and all other vertically merged cells must be empty.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.CellFormat.WordWrap
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to wrap text in a cell.
member.remarks: This property only affects the behavior of the cell when the for this table is set to true. This property shall be interpreted in the context of the property as follows: If the table cell width is fixed, then this property specifies that that this table cell shall never be smaller than that fixed value when other cells on the line are not at their absolute minimum width. If the table cell width is relatuve or auto, then this property specifies that when running the auto fit algorithm, the contents of that this table cell shall be treated as though they have no breaking characters (the contents should be treated as a single contiguous non - breaking string).

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.CellFormat.GridSpan
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of grid columns in the parent table's table grid that shall be spanned by the current cell. This property allows cells to have the appearance of being merged, as they span vertical boundaries of other cells in the table.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.CellFormat.ConditionalStyleOptions
member.summary: Specifies the set of conditional table style formatting properties that have been applied to content.
member.remarks: This enumeration is an optimization that is used by consumers to determine if a given property on a content is the result of the table style conditional formatting properties vs. direct formatting on the table cell itself. It specifies the components of the conditional formatting in the table style applied to this content, so that the table's conditional formatting can be applied after the document is displayed without having the table style properties override the style hierarchy.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.RowFormat
member.summary: Represents formatting for a table row.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.RowFormat.#ctor(GrapeCity.Documents.Word.IFormatting,System.String)
member.summary: Initialzes a new instance of the class.
member.param: A parent key for the formatting properties in this object.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.RowFormat.Alignment
member.summary: Gets or sets a value specifying how the table row is aligned in the document.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.RowFormat.AllowBreakAcrossPages
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the contents within the current cell can be split between pages.
member.remarks: When displaying the contents of a table cell, it is possible that a page break would fall within the contents of a table cell, causing the contents of that cell to be displayed across two different pages. If this property is false, then all contents of a table row shall be rendered on the same page by moving the start of the current row to the start of a new page if necessary. If the contents of this table row cannot fit on a single page, then this row shall start on a new page and flow onto multiple pages as necessary.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.RowFormat.HeadingFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the current table row shall be repeated at the top of each new page on which part of this table is displayed. This gives this table row the behavior of a 'header' row on each of these pages. This property can be applied to any number of rows at the top of the table structure in order to generate multi-row table headers.
member.remarks: If false, this table row shall not be repeated on each new page on which the table is displayed. As well, if this row is not contiguously connected with the first row of the table (that is, if this table row is not either the first row, or all rows between this row and the first row are not marked as header rows) then this property shall be ignored.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.RowFormat.Height
member.summary: Gets or sets the height of the table row in points.
member.remarks: The meaning of the value is defined based on the value of the value for this table row as follows: If the value of is , then the table row height should be automatically determined based on the height of its contents. This value is ignored. If the value of is , then the table row's height should be at least the value of this property. If the value of is , then the table row's height should be exactly the value of this property.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.RowFormat.HeightRule
member.summary: Gets or sets the rule for determining the height of the table row.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.RowFormat.Spacing
member.summary: Gets or sets the default amount of space (in points) between the cells.
